column1: #Text=For other people named Hüseyin Pasha , see Hüseyin Pasha ( disambiguation ) .
#Text=( died July 1624 ) was an Ottoman statesman of Albanian origin . [ 1 ]
#Text=He was two times Grand Vizier of the Ottoman Empire in 1622 and 1623 , [ 2 ] and previously the Ottoman governor of Egypt between 1620 and 1622 . [ 1 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ]

#Text= comes from the word for " Take it !

column1: #Text=" in Albanian ; he was nicknamed so because of the many times he ordered his men to " take [ the heads ] " of his opponents , i.e. execute them .

#Text=As the governor of Egypt , Hüseyin Pasha 's manners were described as  rough and unpolished .
